= Christianity }} 'John Richard Kasich' (; born May 13, 1952) is the 69th and current Governor of
Ohio. A member of the Republican Party, he previously
served as a member of the United States House of Representatives, representing
from 1983 to 2001. He was a commentator on Fox News
Channel, hosting [[Heartland with John Kasich]] (2001-2007); he also worked as
an investment banker, as managing director of Lehman Brothers's Columbus, Ohio
office (until the firm collapsed in 2008).

In the 2010 Ohio gubernatorial election, Kasich defeated Democratic incumbent
Ted Strickland, receiving 49% of the vote to his opponent's 47%. {{cite news|work=Ohio Secretary of State|title=Governor and
Lieutenant Governor: November 2, 2010 |url=http://www.sos.state.oh.us/SOS/elect-
ions/electResultsMain/2010results/20101102governor.aspx}}
